Attention, Parents of all KUSD Elementary School Students!
Konocti Education Center (KEC) is home to the Visual and Performing Arts program, which incorporates drama, dance, music, and art into instructional time.

Starting in the 2020-2021 school year, KEC will continue its commitment to the Arts while expanding our focus to include science, technology, engineering and mathematics, with a goal of transitioning to a full STEAM program.

If your child is currently in third grade and wants to experience these exciting opportunities, please contact the Welcome Center to register: 707-994-0900.

If you have any questions about KEC and its programs, please contact Principal Ami Barker (ami.barker@konoctiusd.org), Assistant Principal Monte Williams (monte.williams@konoctiusd.org) or counselor Kelsey Wiley (kelsey.wiley@konoctiusd.org).

Update Re: COVID19 from the Superintendent of Konocti Unified School District. We wanted to provide you with an update regarding the coronavirus. As always, the safety and wellness of our students is our first priority. We continue to remain in daily contact with Dr. Pace from the Department of Public Health, the Lake County Office of Education and the CDC for the most current updates and recommendations. Based on the latest information, Konocti Schools will remain open at this time. As a precautionary measure, based on Public Health recommendations, we are cancelling all non-essential group meetings and events. This includes, but is not limited to, sports events, evening performances, field trips as well as other activities. Please refer to our District website and school facebook pages for additional and updated information. The situation continues to change daily. There will be an update sent on Sunday evening with any additional information gathered over the weekend.

Visit our webpage at konoctiusd.org for full details.
